alert.note: Alert for De Baca County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 7:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL DE BACA COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 719 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Yeso to 13 miles northeast of Mesa. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner and Sumner Lake. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 308 and 330. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.
